titleStmt.title: Edgar Keenon to Richard T. Jacob
CWG4857

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KENNON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed.Frankfort, Ky., April 15, 1864.
Hon R. T. Jacobs
Lieut & Act Governor of Ky
Dr Sir

D. B. Capps writes this day paid balance of Revenue due from him as clk of the Owsley cir court from 10 Nov 1856 to 9 Nov 1857 & now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of Eleven 97/100 Dollars this being the amt adjudged against him ^as Damages^ for the nonpayment of the Revenue due from him as clk &c as aforesaid

Remit damages
Richard T. Jacob
Lt & Act. Gov

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
Sureties of
D B Capps
Clk
of $111.97
Damages
18th Apl/64
